author: Paul Irving
title: Churchill Wasn’t ‘Over the Hill’ in 1940
text:
Gary Oldman’s Oscar-nominated portrayal of Winston Churchill in “Darkest Hour” has kindled a re-examination of the British prime minister’s leadership during the early days of World War II. One fact often missed is that Churchill was 65 when his defining moment arrived. It came only because voters believe in second acts.

Too often, employers do not. Because of the ageist assumptions prevalent in the modern workplace, many people Churchill’s age never get their own second shot. Age should never be the sole basis for deciding...
